title: There Are Many Reasons to Use Apple 's New Password Manager -- WSJ
region: namz : North America | usa : United States
sentence: The revamped app is free and pre-downloaded onto Apple devices with the latest software By Nicole Nguyen The internet is a dangerous place, and people who reuse the same tired password everywhere are sitting ducks.

title: 'Sextortion' Scams Involving Apple Messages Ended in Tragedy for These Boys -- WSJ

title: For This Boeing Family, the Job Is the Same. The Payoff Isn't; Working at the jet maker gave the Merwins a middle-class life near Seattle, but they say 'the company is not that ticket anymore'
region: namz : North America | seattl : Seattle | usa : United States | usw : Western U.S. | uswa : Washington State
sentence: For the young family, Boeing was a way out of low-income, dangerous mining work.

title: Can Boeing Be Fixed? Aerospace Leaders Offer a Repair Manual -- WSJ
region: namz : North America | usa : United States
sentence: Boeing executives for years have tried and failed to break a dangerous habit: traveled work, a term for tasks that are completed out of their ordinary sequence on the production line.
sentenceRaw: Boeing executives for years have tried and failed to break a dangerous habit: traveled work, a term for tasks that are completed out of their ordinary sequence on the production line.

title: Can Boeing Be Fixed? Aerospace Leaders Offer a Repair Manual -- WSJ
region: namz : North America | usa : United States
sentence: Its dangerous habit of pushing unfinished planes down the production line stems from suppliers being unable to deliver the right parts at the right time, said Bill Osborne, former head of quality for Boeing's defense and space business.
sentenceRaw: Its dangerous habit of pushing unfinished planes down the production line stems from suppliers being unable to deliver the right parts at the right time, said Bill Osborne, former head of quality for Boeing's defense and space business.

title: FAA's proposed $3.1 million fine to Boeing inadequate, senator says
region: namz : North America | usa : United States
sentence: "For Boeing, such fines are easily absorbed as the cost of doing business, not a meaningful deterrent to dangerous behavior," Blumenthal wrote in a letter to FAA Administrator Bryan Bedford.
sentenceRaw: "For Boeing, such fines are easily absorbed as the cost of doing business, not a meaningful deterrent to dangerous behavior," Blumenthal wrote in a letter to FAA Administrator Bryan Bedford.

title: UPDATE 1-US senator calls FAA's proposed $3.1 million Boeing fine inadequate
region: namz : North America | usa : United States | usak : Alaska | usw : Western U.S.
sentence: "For Boeing, such fines are easily absorbed as the cost of doing business, not a meaningful deterrent to dangerous behavior," Blumenthal wrote in a letter sent on Tuesday and released on Wednesday to FAA Administrator Bryan Bedford, an appointee of Republican President Donald Trump.
sentenceRaw: "For Boeing, such fines are easily absorbed as the cost of doing business, not a meaningful deterrent to dangerous behavior," Blumenthal wrote in a letter sent on Tuesday and released on Wednesday to FAA Administrator Bryan Bedford, an appointee of Republican President Donald Trump.

title: *DOJ Sues Walgreens Boots Alliance ; Alleges 'Walgreens Knowingly Filled Millions of Prescriptions that Lacked a Legitimate Medical Purpose'
region: namz : North America | usa : United States
sentence: 17 Jan 2025 15:54 ET *DOJ Alleges Walgreens Filled Prescriptions for 'dangerous and Excessive Quantities of Opioids' 17 Jan 2025 15:56 ET *DOJ Alleges Walgreens Pressured Pharmacists to Fill Prescriptions Quickly Without Taking Time Needed to Confirm Validity 17 Jan 2025 15:57 ET *DOJ Alleges Walgreens Disregarded Obligations Under Controlled Substances Act and False Claims Act (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires January 17, 2025 15:57 ET (20:57 GMT)
sentenceRaw: 17 Jan 2025 15:54 ET *DOJ Alleges Walgreens Filled Prescriptions for 'Dangerous and Excessive Quantities of Opioids' 17 Jan 2025 15:56 ET *DOJ Alleges Walgreens Pressured Pharmacists to Fill Prescriptions Quickly Without Taking Time Needed to Confirm Validity 17 Jan 2025 15:57 ET *DOJ Alleges Walgreens Disregarded Obligations Under Controlled Substances Act and False Claims Act (MORE TO FOLLOW) Dow Jones Newswires January 17, 2025 15:57 ET (20:57 GMT)

title: Press Release Robbins LLP Reminds Investors of Walgreens Boots Alliance , Inc. (WBA) of the Pending Lead Plaintiff Deadline and Urges Investors to Obtain Counsel
region: namz : North America | sdie : San Diego | usa : United States | usca : California | usw : Western U.S.
sentence: Specifically, the DOJ's "complaint alleges that, from approximately August 2012 through the present, Walgreens knowingly filled millions of prescriptions for controlled substances that lacked a legitimate medical purpose, were not valid, and/or were not issued in the usual course of professional practice", including "prescriptions for dangerous and excessive quantities of opioids, prescriptions for early refills of opioids and prescriptions for the especially dangerous and abused combination of drugs known as the 'trinity,' which is made up of an opioid, a benzodiazepine and a muscle relaxant."
sentenceRaw: Specifically, the DOJ's "complaint alleges that, from approximately August 2012 through the present, Walgreens knowingly filled millions of prescriptions for controlled substances that lacked a legitimate medical purpose, were not valid, and/or were not issued in the usual course of professional practice", including "prescriptions for dangerous and excessive quantities of opioids, prescriptions for early refills of opioids and prescriptions for the especially dangerous and abused combination of drugs known as the 'trinity,' which is made up of an opioid, a benzodiazepine and a muscle relaxant."
